job_title: Behavior Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: The kids are amazing, and the staff is highly supportive and the skills you learn will be invaluable, especially if you are interested in becoming an educator. They provide excellent health benefits and there is lots of time off due to breaks.
cons: This job does not pay enough for what it requires. You also do not get paid during school breaks.

review_title: Everyones heart is in the right place

cons: non-profit pay, but that's to be expected.

pros: You get the opportunity to work with students in a team environment with amazing adult to student ratios.
cons: You get furloughed for winter break, spring break, summer break, non-school days infinitum.

review_title: Making a difference but with little support from admin
pros: Working with kids on the autism spectrum is very rewarding! I went home feeling like I had made a difference.
cons: Directors don't make an effort to get to know their staff. High turn over rate! Wonder why? Not enough quality support for teachers and behaviors assistants. Disorganized when it comes to Keeping legal paper work in order. My co-workers were constantly getting injured on the job which was scary. Minor injuries were expected and we were trained on how to handle them, but I saw too many good staff having to deal with unnecessary injuries that could have been avoided if there was more staff and they had access to better information on kids.

pros: This is an environment where you can seriously make a difference and go home feeling good about what you've done. You'll be surrounded by people who feel the same way, and that makes things great.
cons: The work can be hard, sometimes frustrating, occasionally heartbreaking. Also, depending on which site you work at there can be issues specific to that location.

review_title: Pros and Cons to working here
pros: The administration, teachers, and assistants are all very compassionate and wonderful people. There is a strong sense of community and respect throughout the campus. Senior staff is always willing to help mentor and assist newer staff.
cons: The pay does not match the workload. Assistants make very little money and the income is inconstant because of the breaks throughout the school year.

cons: Be ready to positively affect lives, its a fast paced environment with plenty of support and training.

review_title: Great Place to Work, Great People to Work With
